data.title: Budget friendly Gem in the desert!
data.text: This place is great.. And all we have used is the pool. We visited on a 108 degree day and the sections of the pool were awesome for the kids and parents alike. There is a good amount of shade, water slides, and lap pool for the more experienced swimmers. Great way to beat the heat!

data.title: Not that impressive
data.text: Need to upgrade the lake near the Aquatic Center.  Need to add and indoor pool or a heat pump.  Need more shade so parent can seat and watch their kids. Surprise needs is a indoor/outdoor waterpark for the kids in the summer.

data.title: It's alright
data.text: Took my kids here, it was a bit chaotic. There is no control. The staff really depends on the parents to help with thier children. Seemed a bit Understaffed for my liking. But it was clean.

data.title: An oasis in the desert.
data.text: When Surprise was being built, there was the stadium skeleton and the aquatic center.  The slide is so fun, you'd think it was a place that you had to pay $35 to get in to.  There are kid pools and water features for little ones too. The pools are clean, excellent shape, and have great supervision.  There is a nice snack bar, and playground with sand volleyball courts outside.  Right next to the center is a lovely lake with swans, geese and ducks, as well as the Surprise Library.  Just a gorgeous place to walk, exercise, swim, socialize and play.

data.title: Wrong Photos
data.text: Photos are from World Wildlife Zoo and Aquarium, approximately 7 miles away from this water park.   The zoo and aquarium are not in Surprise.

data.title: great family swimming
data.text: Well done public pool with separate diving pool w/3 boards.  Slide that kids love.  Reasonably priced and adjacent to nice family park, kids fishing "lake"

data.title: Great facilities
data.text:
Polite and courteous staff made the visit very enjoyable. The kiddo pool area is outstanding and very well monitored. I'm surprised that this place hasn't been rated by
major media outlets.

data.title: Nice city pool
data.text: Nice city owned pool in Surprise. Wonderful pool play area for the kids  with slides water sprinklers. Staff is friendly and life guards adequate.

data.title: Nice family Place
data.text: I really like the kiddy pool area.  The water ranges from 1" deep to about 3' deep. There are shaded bleachers to sit on.  Could be a little cleaner, but otherwise a very nice place to be on a hot day.

data.title: Wrong Photos, This is Wildlife World Zoo
data.text: Gave 3 stars because these photos are of Wildlife Zoo which is a fantastic place to visit.  Aquatic Ctr, is also nice for kids as other reviewers have stated but is crowded.

data.title: Very busy but fun
data.text: The surprise aquatic center is a great place for kids to go to get out and play. It is always busy, but there are plenty of lifeguards on duty. The staff is always very nice as well. There is a snack bar as well, in case you find yourself staying longer than you thought you would.

data.title: Not as nice as it once was
data.text: The place isn't as nice as it once was.  It tends to be too crowded and for reasons unknown, the people who visit tend to be rude and inconsiderate of others.  I used to visit here regularly, but my visits have dropped to about twice a summer since it has gone down hill.

data.title: Great Pool and Staff
data.text: A great swimming facility. It has a zero depth entry with fun water features, two slides, two diving boards and a whirlpool fun zone.

data.title: right across the street
data.text: didn't get in but right across the street so this is a super location to take in spring training

data.title: Good place to learn swimming
data.text: Great instructors for the 5 year old swimmer classes!  Attentive, fun and patient!

data.title: Great except one change needs to be made...
data.text:
In over 100 degree weather you should not have kids waiting in a long line for the slides then call a drill for lifeguards and make the same kids line up in a long line again, this is extremely dangerous in this heat! We went July 1st where we had excessive heat warnings, about 20 kids in line and with no shade over the stairs, you are just asking for kids to collapse in this heat. 
The correct way to do it and the way local gyms do it at their pool is if you know a drill will be called, close off the slides about 10 minutes in advance and allow all kids waiting to go to finish sliding down, call the drill and at the end re-open the line for the slides. 
You should also provide more shade not just in the bleacher area.

data.title: Lots cheaper than a water park but still fun for kids.
data.text:
The aquatic center has a decent sized pool with deeper water for those who want to swim, as well as very shallow water for little ones.  And of course, something in the middle!  They have two water slides that the kids love to go down, a 'whirlpool' area that they love to get caught in, and even the little kid area has some fun water toys that dump and spray water as you splash around.  Lifeguards everywhere and a few benches and shade for those who aren't swimming.  The price is right - $5 for non-residents, but only $2 for adult residents and $.50 for kids. 

The only bummer is that they don't open for public swimming until the afternoon.  The hottest part of the day, so I guess that's good - but it would be nice to be able to go when the sun isn't directly overhead.
